oai_dc:dc.dc:title: White, Hu L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: engraved by T.B. Welch
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hugh (Hu) Lawson White (1773-1840). Jurist and statesman, he was the oldest son of the founder of Knoxville, James White, and his wife Mary Lawson White. The etching was engraved by T.B. Welch from a painting by E.G. Leutze. Engraved portrait of Hugh Lawson White, frontispiece printed in Nancy N. Scott. A Memoir of Hugh Lawson White, Judge of the Supreme Court of Tennessee, Member of the Senate of the United States, etc., etc. with Selections from his Speeches and Correspondence (Philadelphia: J. B. Lippincott Co., 1856 ).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Portraits; Etchings;
